newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: PRESS DIGEST - Philippine newspapers - April 23.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Philippine newspapers - April 23.

text.p: These are the leading stories in Manila newspapers on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- The government and the Moro National Islamic Liberation Front (MILF) peace panels are set to resume today dialogues on various issues, including complaints on reported provocations among their forces. (BULLETIN)
- President Ramos created yesterday a national executive committee that will make arrangements for the state funeral of the late President Diosdado Macapagal. (ALL NEWSPAPERS)

- The peace negotiations between the government and the National Democratic Front (NDF) hit an impasse yesterday over the issue of human rights, fuelling apprehension of a further delay in the scheduled completion of the talks by the middle of the year. (JOURNAL)

- The latest version of the House of Representatives on the last component of the Comprehensive Tax Reform Package is putting wedge between Senate leaders. The House had proposed to give exemptions of 146,000 pesos a year on income taxes.

- Empire East Land Holdings Inc was on the hot seat yesterday as questions about its financial health reverberated in the stock market, causing the entire bourse to succumb to heavy selling pressure. (ALL NEWSPAPERS)

- Cash-strapped Victorias Milling Co Inc will finally be placed on the auction block in the next 15 to 30 days, according to Rafael Buenaventura, president of Philippine Commercial International Bank. (ALL NEWSPAPERS)
